books.title: Eloquent JavaScript, Third Edition
books.subtitle: A Modern Introduction to Programming
books.author: Marijn Haverbeke
books.description: JavaScript lies at the heart of almost every modern web application, from social apps like Twitter to browser-based game frameworks like Phaser and Babylon. Though simple for beginners to pick up and play with, JavaScript is a flexible, complex language that you can use to build full-scale applications.

books.title: Practical Modern JavaScript
books.subtitle: Dive into ES6 and the Future of JavaScript
books.author: Nicolás Bevacqua
books.description: To get the most out of modern JavaScript, you need learn the latest features of its parent specification, ECMAScript 6 (ES6). This book provides a highly practical look at ES6, without getting lost in the specification or its implementation details.

books.title: Understanding ECMAScript 6
books.subtitle: The Definitive Guide for JavaScript Developers
books.author: Nicholas C. Zakas
books.description: ECMAScript 6 represents the biggest update to the core of JavaScript in the history of the language. In Understanding ECMAScript 6, expert developer Nicholas C. Zakas provides a complete guide to the object types, syntax, and other exciting changes that ECMAScript 6 brings to JavaScript.

books.title: Speaking JavaScript
books.subtitle: An In-Depth Guide for Programmers
books.author: Axel Rauschmayer
books.description: Like it or not, JavaScript is everywhere these days -from browser to server to mobile- and now you, too, need to learn the language or dive deeper than you have. This concise book guides you into and through JavaScript, written by a veteran programmer who once found himself in the same position.

books.title: Learning JavaScript Design Patterns
books.subtitle: A JavaScript and jQuery Developer's Guide
books.author: Addy Osmani
books.description: With Learning JavaScript Design Patterns, you'll learn how to write beautiful, structured, and maintainable JavaScript by applying classical and modern design patterns to the language. If you want to keep your code efficient, more manageable, and up-to-date with the latest best practices, this book is for you.

books.title: You Don't Know JS Yet
books.subtitle: Get Started
books.author: Kyle Simpson
books.description: The worldwide best selling You Don't Know JS book series is back for a 2nd edition: You Don't Know JS Yet. All 6 books are brand new, rewritten to cover all sides of JS for 2020 and beyond.

books.title: Pro Git
books.subtitle: Everything you neeed to not know about Git
books.author: Scott Chacon and Ben Straub

books.title: Head First Design Patterns
books.subtitle: Building Extensible and Maintainable Object-Oriented Software
books.author: Eric Freeman, Elisabeth Robson
books.description: You know you don't want to reinvent the wheel, so you look to Design Patterns: the lessons learned by those who've faced the same software design problems. With Design Patterns, you get to take advantage of the best practices and experience of others so you can spend your time on something more challenging. Something more fun. This book shows you the patterns that matter, when to use them and why, how to apply them to your own designs, and the object-oriented design principles on which they're based. Join hundreds of thousands of developers who've improved their object-oriented design skills through Head First Design Patterns.

books.title: Head First Design Patterns
books.subtitle: Building Extensible and Maintainable Object-Oriented Software
books.author: Eric Freeman, Elisabeth Robson
books.description: You know you don't want to reinvent the wheel, so you look to Design Patterns: the lessons learned by those who've faced the same software design problems. With Design Patterns, you get to take advantage of the best practices and experience of others so you can spend your time on something more challenging. Something more fun. This book shows you the patterns that matter, when to use them and why, how to apply them to your own designs, and the object-oriented design principles on which they're based. Join hundreds of thousands of developers who've improved their object-oriented design skills through Head First Design Patterns.

books.title: Dirty Code, but it works!
books.subtitle: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.description: Even good code can function. But if code isn’t dirty, it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year, countless hours and significant resources are gained because of properly written code. But it has to be that way.
